meanings.definition: To hit or strike with a sharp blow
meanings.sent1: The cat swatted at the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: She swatted the fly buzzing around her head.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten swatted at the dangling string.
meanings.sent4: The boxer swatted his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The teacher swatted the desk to get the students' attention.

meanings.definition: To crush or flatten with a sharp blow
meanings.sent1: He swatted the spider crawling on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The chef swatted the garlic with the flat side of the knife.
meanings.sent3: The toddler swatted the playdough into a pancake.
meanings.sent4: The giant swatted the tiny village with one hand.
meanings.sent5: The player swatted the ball out of the opponent's reach.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike at with a sweeping motion
meanings.sent1: The wind swatted the leaves off the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: She swatted the dust off the bookshelf with a cloth.
meanings.sent3: The broom swatted the spiderwebs in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The tennis player swatted the ball across the court.
meanings.sent5: The chef swatted the cutting board to clear the crumbs.
